intro: Castanopsis balansae, commonly known as the Balansae tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Castanopsis. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland to montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
